tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
The meaning of the word "michtam" is uncertain. You may use the word "psalm" instead. This can be written as: "This is a psalm that David wrote."
Going to Yahweh for protection is spoken of as taking refuge in him. AT: "go to you for protection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the holy people who are on the earth
tn.text: Here "holy people" refers to God's own people who trust him. AT: "your people who live in this land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "The troubles of those who seek other gods will increase" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: pour out ... blood to their gods
tn.text: "make sacrifices to their gods" (UDB)

tn.ref: lift up their names with my lips
tn.text: Lifting up "their names with my lips" represents praising the other gods or praying to them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here David speaks of Yahweh as if he were a portion of land that has been given to him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here David speaks of Yahweh as if he were a cup that contains many blessings. AT: "the one who blesses me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"You determine my future"

God's blessings for David are spoken of as if they were a section of land that had been surveyed for him to possess. "Measuring lines" represents the surveyor's cords. This can be stated in active form. AT: "The place you have provided for me is pleasant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: surely a pleasing inheritance is mine
tn.text: Here David speaks of Yahweh's blessings as if they were an inheritance that he has received. AT: "I am delighted with all the things that he has given me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I set Yahweh before me at all times
tn.text: "I always remember that Yahweh is with me"

tn.ref: so I will not be shaken from his right hand
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "nothing will take me away from his side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
David continues to speak to God.

tn.ref: Therefore my heart is glad; my glory is rejoicing
tn.text: The speaker is saying that it brings him honor to be able to praise God. Both of these clauses express very similar meanings. AT: "Therefore I am glad; I am honored to praise him" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here the "heart" represents the speaker's thoughts and emotions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Many versions, including the UDB, interpret "my glory" to mean the heart of the writer, who is honored to rejoice because of God.
"great" or "a large amount of"
The writer speaks of "joy" as if it were a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
The words "right hand" indicate being in God's special presence. AT: "when I am near you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
